identified-content.person: PARKER, JULIA DU PONT (JULIA DU PONT BENELLO)

block.p: Julia du Pont Parker and Allen Carpe Benello were married yesterday by the Rev. William R. Hayward Jr., an Anglican priest, at St. Mark's Church in Smith's Parish, Bermuda.

The bride, 30, is a documentary film producer and is working on ''Blue Vinyl . . . A Toxic Comedy,'' about the environment and the vinyl industry, for the Cinemax cable channel. She graduated from Barnard College. She is the daughter of Susan Bissell Parker of Smith's Parish and the late George Macdonald Parker, who was the president of the General Atlantic Group, an investment company based in Bermuda.
Julia du Pont Parker and Allen Carpe Benello were married yesterday by the Rev. William R. Hayward Jr., an Anglican priest, at St. Mark's Church in Smith's Parish, Bermuda.

The bride, 30, is a documentary film producer and is working on ''Blue Vinyl . . . A Toxic Comedy,'' about the environment and the vinyl industry, for the Cinemax cable channel. She graduated from Barnard College. She is the daughter of Susan Bissell Parker of Smith's Parish and the late George Macdonald Parker, who was the president of the General Atlantic Group, an investment company based in Bermuda.
The bride is a descendant of Eleuthere Irenee du Pont, the founder of the DuPont Company.

The bridegroom, 35, is the general partner of White River Partners, a private investment group in New York. He graduated from Tufts University and received a master's degree in international relations from Johns Hopkins University. He is the son of Dr. Lestra Carpe Benello of Hanover, N.H., and the late Prof. Charles G. Benello. The bridegroom's mother, a retired internist, was a clinical physician at Harvard University Student Health Services in Cambridge, Mass. His father was a professor of sociology at Hampshire College in Amherst, Mass.
